title: Welcome To League of Legends Season 8!
body:
Do you wanna make your team and enemy jealous of how good you are? Do you wanna climb the ladder in becoming the best league player!? Do you want to be able to join an eSports team for league and compete!? Well too bad because everyone does insane damage level 1 and unless youre an ADC or Jungler, your role dont matter one bit. But remember to have fun on the rift and keep toxicity at a low even when youre getting stomped and cant do anything about it. Good luck out there summoner!

https://imgur.com/Ookej7I
https://imgur.com/bHg3ep8
https://imgur.com/vwmXKkO

The game is no longer about you as a player, but your team. Shorter games means damage is too high and is just reliant on who has the better team. Longer games means you can actually carry the game as a solo player due to damage being low. "Solo" queue isnt even revolved around skill that much anymore. Its just based off luck, did you get the team that knows not to overextend, ward and take obj? Grats you win. Did you get the team that overextends, 1v1s enemy champs when theyre 1/7, jungler afk farms while enemy jg constantly ganks, never wards? Welp gg you lose. 

Can we go back to the old days of league, this league is just boring and unfun. I see so many people post on the boards about that game being wack, I have never seen this many people complain about the game. Normally before season 7, people would only complain about 3 things (Duskblade, Ardent Censor, Lethality), and youd only see about 3 posts a day complaining about the game. Now its every day im seeing 20+ posts complaining about the games balance. Yet Riot still doesnt respond, Riot wont acknowledge us as a fan base wanting to enjoy their game. 

Fix damage, fix power creep, fix catchup exp, balance the keystones (who even takes inspiration anymore besides Ezreal?), fix health regen (0 reason why I should be seeing ADC players build Dorans Shield in plat 3+). If Riot did all this, the game would be way more balanced than this mess we have now.

Riot needs to introduce a ff@5 for when its already 1vs6 in kills. You can pretty much tell its gg.

(Joking btw, people wont even ff@15 when its 14vs44 in kills lol)

Because that's the NA LoL mentality.

If you compare games in Korea with games in NA, Korea has shorter games and a high ff rate because they know when a game is lost. In NA we are given the "Never give up! You can always comeback!" mentality. 

I mean it is possible to comeback, I've done it before and I'm sure you guys have, but it's usually because the champion they feed scales badly into the late game.

According to Riot giving criticism or telling them how to play better means it's being toxic which will result in a chat ban or a 14 day ban. Meanwhile in Korea you can say whatever you want and you wont even get punished.

There is a reason why NA teams try to get Korean Players but Korean teams don't have any NA players.

Because in Korea they get a lot of heavy criticism on their plays making them improve, they play more games so they can keep learning. Meanwhile in NA you're going to be spending 20 minutes or even more trapped in a game because your teammates keep thinking that it's possible for you to come back. 

Don't get me wrong, NA players too give criticism but reddit white knights make a forum thread complaining about them which results with them getting a ban.

Riot should introduce ff@champ select to be honest. You can tell how the game is gonna go by checking op.ggs most of the time.

Then, you can also have ff@5 minutes. You can also tell how the game is gonna go, by watching your jungler start top-side blue buff. Or your ADC not knowing how to cs. Or having support open with Doran's Shield. Or Tryndamere top take corrupting potion with Arcane Comet. lol

This game is just a mess.

You can't call it a solo game, because solo players really can't win by themselves often.

You can't call it teambased either because a single solo player can fuck it up so bad that they lose aswell.

There is both too much and too little influence on any single player. it comes down to how the game is structured. it is a solo (or duo) experience for the first half, but the second half is a team experience.
The solo experience directly affects the team experience. if you fucked up real bad in the first half everyone is going to pay for it in the second half.

The way to fix the game is probably to remove that all together, without jeopardizing the separation. the solo experience into the team experience is what makes league a good game. 

i can't think of a good way to fix it.

What I dislike most about the game at the moment has been wonderfully summarized by Bricky: "One person can lose you the game, but one person cannot win you the game." I agree. If one person besides maybe the support falls behind, or any person feeds 2 or more kills to a high priority champ, you lose. Outplays are hard to do anymore. Catching up is virtually impossible. Non-AP supports aren't as viable. Bruisers don't do as much, while juggernauts can 2-shot you and live with full or at least 3/4 HP. Damage on every champ is either too high or too low, with some exceptions. Healing does either too much or too little. Some items are almost mandatory, and some are almost unable to be purchased except on a select few champs (despite them being rather neat items). To top it all off, LCS is boring to me and all the friends that play league with me. I would hate to see this game die but currently that is the direction I see it heading. I hope riot will see this, or maybe some point similar, and correct their mistake. I don't see any further growth for this game currently. I do hope it improves.
